query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Taciti, soli, sanza compagnia 2 n’andavam l’un dinanzi e l’altro dopo, 3 come frati minor vanno per via.
query.error: **English:** 1 Silent, alone, without company, 2 we went, one in front and the other behind, 3 like friars minor going on their way.
query.result: 1 Þa weard ic stille, ana sundor, butan gefērum, 2 we eodon forð, ān beforan and ān æfter, 3 swā swā gebrōðru dōð on wege.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Vòlt’ era in su la favola d’Isopo 5 lo mio pensier per la presente rissa, 6 dov’ el parlò de la rana e del topo;
query.error: **English:** 4 My thoughts were turned to Aesop’s fable 5 about the present conflict, 6 where he spoke of the frog and the mouse;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 ché più non si pareggia ‘mo’ e ‘issa’ 8 che l’un con l’altro fa, se ben s’accoppia 9 principio e fine con la mente fissa.
query.error: **English:** 7 for “now” and “then” are no more alike 8 than the beginning and the end, if one considers them closely 9 with a fixed mind.
query.result: 7 forðæm næs “nū” and “ðā” māre gelicre 8 þonne ǣr and siððan, gif man gerīpe 9 frumsceaft and ende fæste geþōhte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 E come l’un pensier de l’altro scoppia, 11 così nacque di quello un altro poi, 12 che la prima paura mi fé doppia.
query.error: **English:** 10 And as one thought bursts from another, 11 so from that one another was born, 12 which doubled my first fear.
query.result: 10 And swa swa ðæs anes ðoht ðæs oðres ðohte breac, 11 swa ðær of ðam oðer ðoht wearð geboren, 12 ðe me ða ða forman fyrhto twyfealde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Io pensava così: ‘Questi per noi 14 sono scherniti con danno e con beffa 15 sì fatta, ch’assai credo che lor nòi.
query.error: **English:** 13 I thought thus: ‘These people are scorned by us 14 with harm and mockery 15 so great that I believe their name is stained.
query.result: 13 Ic ða ðohte ðus: ‘Þas ðe we ðus 14 mid teonan and mid teonwordum 15 swa swiðe hwonlice hynðon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Se l’ira sovra ’l mal voler s’aggueffa, 17 ei ne verranno dietro più crudeli 18 che ’l cane a quella lievre ch’elli acceffa’.
query.error: **English:** 16 If anger seizes upon the evil will, 17 they will come after us more cruelly 18 than the dog after the hare that it catches.
query.result: 16 Gif ðone yfelan willan ða wraðu oferswið, 17 ða cumað ða wyrsan him æfter 18 ðonne ðone haran ðe se hund ofslihð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Già mi sentia tutti arricciar li peli 20 de la paura e stava in dietro intento, 21 quand’ io dissi: «Maestro, se non celi

query.result: 19 Þa ic feorran gehyrde ðara deofla hleopor 20 and ðara synfullra sawla wop and heora yfela geomerung, 21 þa ic cwæð: "La leofran min, hwæt is ðeos stefn ðe ic gehyrde?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 te e me tostamente, i’ ho pavento 23 d’i Malebranche. Noi li avem già dietro; 24 io li ’magino sì, che già li sento».
query.error: **English:** 22 yourself and me quickly, I fear 23 the Malebranche. We have them already behind us; 24 I imagine them so that I already hear them."
query.result: 22 He ða cwæð: "Þis is ðara earmra sawla ðe forleton God and his beboda 23 and ðurh ða synna ðe hi geworhton syndon hi nu on ðære helle witu." 24 Þa ic ða ðæt gehyrde, þa weop ic ða swiðe sare

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 E quei: «S’i’ fossi di piombato vetro, 26 l’imagine di fuor tua non trarrei 27 più tosto a me, che quella dentro ’mpetro.
query.error: **English:** 25 And he: "If I were made of leaded glass, 26 I would not draw your outward image to me 27 any more quickly than I do that which is imprinted within me.
query.result: 25 And se cwæð: "Gif ic wære of leaded glæs, 26 ðinre utanlican ansyne ic ne mihte geteon 27 to me selfum ðy hraðor ðonne ðæt ðe binnan me is."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Pur mo venieno i tuo’ pensier tra ’ miei, 29 con simile atto e con simile faccia, 30 sì che d’intrambi un sol consiglio fei.
query.error: **English:** 28 Just now your thoughts came to mine, 29 with similar action and similar appearance, 30 so that from both I made a single decision.
query.result: 28 Þa comon ðine ðancas to minum, 29 mid gelicum dædum and mid gelicum hiwe, 30 swa ðæt ic of unc bæm anum geþoht geworhte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 S’elli è che sì la destra costa giaccia, 32 che noi possiam ne l’altra bolgia scendere, 33 noi fuggirem l’imaginata caccia».

query.result: 31 Gif he is ðæt his swiðre hippe licge, 32 ðæt we on ða oðre bolgan moten, 33 we ðone wænedan hunt ðurhfleon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Già non compié di tal consiglio rendere, 35 ch’io li vidi venir con l’ali tese 36 non molto lungi, per volerne prendere.
query.error: **English:** 34 He had not yet finished giving such counsel, 35 when I saw them coming with their wings spread 36 not far away, to seize me.
query.result: 34 He næfde nâ giet ðæs gerædes geendod, 35 ðæt ic ðâ geseah ðâ feðerhoman fleogan 36 nealles wyrmlicu, me togeanes fleogan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 37 Min heretoga ða fromlice me nam, 38 swa swa ðæt modor ðe ðurh hreoh bið awreht, 39 and ða neah ðære byrnende lig byð,

query.prompt:

97 Ma voi chi siete, a cui tanto distilla 98 quant’ i’ veggio dolor giù per le guance? 99 e che pena è in voi che sì sfavilla?».
